title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

08:18 <@sdumitriu> Yes

08:25 <vmassol> has quit  
08:43 <CIA-102> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r2fd0bcb / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/web/PreviewAction.java : [cleanup] Improved code style - http://git.io/K4e\_lA  
09:04 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:04 <+tmortagne> looks like agent-4 is unable to start Firefox  
09:08 <+mflorea> yes, I restarted it but it's the same..  
09:08 <+mflorea> well, let's see this build  
09:10 <@cjdelisle> IIRC agent6 was doing that, I tried starting xclock and that worked fine so then I ran the build again and it worked...  
09:11 <+tmortagne> xclock ?  
09:12 <@cjdelisle> It's a trivial program which uses x11, just a way to test that the server is functioning.  
09:13 <+tmortagne> xvnc does not seems to be running indeed  
09:13 <+tmortagne> at least I don't see it with ps aux  
09:13 <+tmortagne> checking hudson start script  
09:13 <@cjdelisle> hmm  
09:14 <+tmortagne> it's calling xvnc\_check.sh as far as I can see  
09:15 <+tmortagne> looking at jenkins slave startup log  
09:16 <+tmortagne> Warning: node4:1 is taken because of /tmp/.X1-lock  
09:16 <+tmortagne> according to the lig it does not start xvnc because of that  
09:16 <+tmortagne> log  
09:16 <+tmortagne> http://ci.xwiki.org/computer/agent-4/log  
09:17 <+tmortagne> but not sure what is taking the lock  
09:17 <@cjdelisle> ahh  
09:17 <@cjdelisle> sounds like it's a case of a stray lock  
09:18 <@cjdelisle> or perhaps I am just a maniac and my first thought when I see a lock is to rm it ;)  
09:18 <+tmortagne> I can see several program running on agent-4 that I don't see on agent-1  
09:18 <+tmortagne> qmgr but seems related to postfix  
09:18 <+tmortagne> they actually all seems to be postfix stuff  
09:20 <+tmortagne> yea new agents all have several program running with postfix user  
09:21 <+tmortagne> so no idea if there is really something taking the lock of if the file has just not been removed for some reason  
09:21 <+tmortagne> theere is nothing in agent-4 that I don't see running on agent-5 too  
09:22 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: WDYT ? lets try to remove the file ?  
09:24 <@cjdelisle> I would  
09:24 <+tmortagne> ok doing it and restarting the slave  
09:27 <+tmortagne> ok better now, lets see

10:56 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:56 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:56 <vmassol> tmortagne: how do I specify that an extension is bundled by default now?  
10:56 <vmassol> (I'm creating a new extension)  
10:56 <vmassol> maybe edit objects? (haven't tried yet)  
10:56 <+sburjan> good morning  
10:58 <vmassol> morning'  
10:58 <+tmortagne> vmassol: as we talked about yesterday I hidden advanced stuff when creating new extension but you have them when editing it  
10:58 <+tmortagne> is it me or xwiki.org seems dead ?  
10:58 <vmassol> I'm editing now tmortagne and I'm not viewing them  
10:58 <+tmortagne> I can access xwiki.org at all  
10:59 <vmassol> yes it's dead for me too  
10:59 <+tmortagne> ha now it's working  
10:59 <vmassol> maybe it's restarting  
10:59 <vmassol> still dead to me  
10:59 <+tmortagne> super slow actually it seems  
11:00 <vmassol> trying edit obbjects now  
11:00 <vmassol> there's a bug tmortagne  
11:00 <vmassol> I didn't fill authors as suggested  
11:01 <+tmortagne> which make xwiki.org slow ?  
11:01 <vmassol> but it says "unknown" and not developed by the xwiki dev team  
11:01 <vmassol> no idea  
11:01 <+tmortagne> I can't access the object or anything  
11:01 <+sburjan> vmassol: what is the best practice ? to re-import the JIra Macro or to patch it directly ?  
11:02 <+tmortagne> if you did not provided any author then the author is unknown, not sure what is a bug. Will see when I can access it...  
11:02 <+sburjan> on xwiki.org  
11:03 <vmassol> tmortagne: when you edit an extension there's no longer the checkbox for the xwiki dev team  
11:03 <+tmortagne> vmassol: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/inline/Extension/Link+Checker+Module work well for me I can see all the field hidden when creating the extension  
11:03 <vmassol> and you've put a comment: fill only if the author isn't the xwiki dev team  
11:04 <+tmortagne> I see a list with "Supported by the XWiki Development Team" isn't that it ?  
11:04 <vmassol> what?  
11:04 <+tmortagne> looks like it's not a checkbox  
11:04 <+tmortagne> vmassol: i did not put any comment it's always been like this  
11:05 <+tmortagne> all I did is to hide advanced stuff when creating the extension  
11:05 <+tmortagne> as you wanted...  
11:06 <vmassol> not really but ok I understand, so I need to edit twice, the comment is wrong now  
11:06 <+tmortagne> yep just forgot about the comment  
11:07 <+tmortagne> well the comment is still kind of true  
11:08 <+tmortagne> problem is that it's not easy to execute code when the extension is newly created  
11:08 <+tmortagne> or we put back the field about XWiki team  
11:08 <vmassol> tmortagne: the icon could be left because it's to be used by everyone i think  
11:08 <vmassol> we want to ahve people use it as much as possible  
11:08 <vmassol> to make pages look nice  
11:09 <+tmortagne> thing is usually you can't put the icon when creating the extension because you can attach it only after  
11:09 <+tmortagne> that's why I removed it  
11:10 <vmassol> it should'n't be attached  
11:10 <vmassol> but instead the user hsould use an existing icon as described  
11:11 <vmassol> (it's in the comment)  
11:11 <vmassol> BTW one optimization maybe tmortagne, when the extension is bundled, should we still list the installation instructions?  
11:12 <vmassol> xwiki.org seems to have auto-healed  
11:12 <+tmortagne> hmm did looked closely at the comment actually since, I saw extension with their own icon I understood it that way  
11:13 <+tmortagne> vmassol: IMO the bundled thing should not even exists since it does not make much sense from Extension Manager POV (does not exists in XR)  
11:13 <+tmortagne> also you may have thing bundled with XEM that you still want to install in XE  
11:13 <+tmortagne> or install in something else  
11:14 <+tmortagne> XE is just one distribution  
11:15 <vmassol> sure but people who go on extensions.xwiki.org should know if they need to install an extesnion or if they already have it  
11:15 <vmassol> somehow...  
11:15 <+tmortagne> icon is back  
11:16 <vmassol> yep just seen it thanks  
11:17 <+tmortagne> vmassol: well depends, it's not really needed when you install your extension from Extension Manager  
11:18 <+tmortagne> and when user will be linked to its XWiki instances he will also know what he already have in extension.xwiki.org  
11:23 <vmassol> tmortagne: is the compatiiblity field displayed when creating a new extension?  
11:23 <vmassol> (I don't recall)  
11:23 <vmassol> if not it should  
11:24 <+tmortagne> vmassol: why ? sound a bit advanced to me  
11:24 <vmassol> it's important information that should be provided absoutely  
11:24 <vmassol> anything not on the first page will not get added  
11:24 <vmassol> (except by us)  
11:24 <vmassol> it's not a problem of advanced  
11:24 <vmassol> for me  
11:25 <vmassol> I think you misunderstood me yesterday  
11:25 <vmassol> (or rather I didn't explain myself clearly)  
11:25 <vmassol> ;)  
11:25 <vmassol> (pick the one you prefer ;))  
11:25 <vmassol> basically yesterday I mostly commented about the technical id  
11:26 <+tmortagne> I don't really see the value of this field, you are supposed to provide the information I can see in it by setting dependencies  
11:26 <vmassol> what field?  
11:26 <+tmortagne> compatibility  
11:26 <vmassol> I don't see any dependency field  
11:26 <vmassol> I'm not talking in 1 month time  
11:26 <vmassol> I'm talking about now  
11:27 <vmassol> I had forgotten to add it msyelf  
11:27 <vmassol> because it wasn't there  
11:32 <vmassol> sdumitriu: could you reply to the UIExtensionClass proposal? I'd like to fix the hardcoding I've done for AllDocs and LinkChecker….  
11:35 <lucaa> has quit  
11:35 <Ruudjah2> has quit  
11:49 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ping  
11:50 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:52 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
11:53 <vmassol> could an interesting enforcer rule: http://mojo.codehaus.org/extra-enforcer-rules/banDuplicateClasses.html  
11:54 <vmassol> (executed only n the ci profile \_ I'm going to try it out, see if it finds anything)

12:30 <vmassol> (with the additional fonts bundled)  
12:41 <Enygma`> has quit  
13:23 <tmortagne> has quit  
13:29 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
13:41 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: using Prototype's Ajax.Updater, is there a way to set a callback that would be called after the container is updated due to a successful request? onSuccess is called before the update and I don't want to test the response code in onComplete, which is called after the update.  
14:01 <CIA-102> tmortagne master \* r78d3bd0 / (6 files in 4 dirs):  
14:01 <CIA-102> XWIKI-7114: Improve XWiki Repository UI  
14:01 <CIA-102> \* use configured id prefix  
14:01 <CIA-102> \* put translations only in XAR - http://git.io/vHazAA  
14:05 <+sburjan> ok, finished porting all the MTR's to user the new JIRA macro  
14:07 <vmassol> sburjan: "what is the best practice ? to re-import the JIra Macro or to patch it directly ?" Whatever is the easiest. What's important is that you try to import it after you've finished to verify it works since it's very easy to break stuff if you edit the xml directly  
14:09 <+sburjan> I understand. We can wait for future releases, it seems to be working quite well ATM  
14:11 <+sburjan> next step is to import it on the internal wikis  
15:05 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
15:43 <Denis> has quit  
15:46 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
16:19 <sburjan> has quit  
16:25 <vmassol> mail from github wasn't set for xeclipse, setting it up now  
16:26 <vmassol> done  
16:34 <vmassol> evalica: be careful when you add new spaces to secure them  
16:34 <vmassol> (otherwise anyone registered can modify the content of doc in those spaces)  
16:35 <+evalica> new spaces?  
16:35 <vmassol> like MenuCode  
16:35 <vmassol> it's a new space  
16:35 <+evalica> k - the idea is that the code should be ported on the main wiki  
16:35 <vmassol> I have only protected default spaces  
16:36 <+evalica> and how do you secure them? like setting the rights?  
16:36 <vmassol> (I protetced Macros space yesterday btw, found it wasn't protected)  
16:36 <vmassol> yes settings the rights  
16:36 <vmassol> and giving edit, comment, delete and admin rights to Admin group only  
16:36 <+evalica> k  
16:36 <+evalica> thanks  
16:36 <vmassol> it's just to be on the safe side… :)  
16:38 <vmassol> for newxwiki you can secure the whole wiki which is faster ;)  
16:51 <CIA-102> Marius Dumitru Florea feature-applicationWithinMinutes \* r2d61862 / (25 files in 18 dirs): Merge branch 'master' of github.com:xwiki/xwiki-platform into feature-applicationWithinMinutes (+8 more commits...) - http://git.io/ckxqQg  
16:55 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: No, there's no other callback between onSuccess and onComplete  
16:55 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: ok, thanks, I ended up using Ajax.Request and updating the container myself  
16:59 <CIA-102> Marius Dumitru Florea feature-applicationWithinMinutes \* r567662b / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-appwithinminutes/src/main/resources/AppWithinMinutes/ClassEditSheet.xml : AppWithinMinutes/ClassEditor: Preview class field when closing configuration pane. - http://git.io/U\_UkRg  
17:30 <+evalica> vmassol:  do you know why it adds "{pre} {pre}" when I have a macro (syntax 2.0 page) included with #includeInContext in a syntax 1.0 page?  
17:32 <+evalica> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome  
17:32 <+evalica> sdumitriu: do you know? the question above with {pre} {pre}  
17:43 <tmortagne> has quit  
17:54 <@sdumitriu> evalica: use $xwiki.includeForm("page name", false)  
17:54 <@sdumitriu> By definition #includeInContext wraps the content in {pre}
